question_details.title: Will a Chinese model have a higher Arena Score than all Anthropic models on the Chatbot Arena Leaderboard at the end of the 1st Quarter of 2025?
question_details.description: CNBC: [China wants to dominate in AI — and some of its models are already beating their U.S. rivals](https://www.cnbc.com/2024/12/17/chinese-ai-models-are-popular-globally-and-are-beating-us-rivals-in-some-areas.html)
question_details.resolution_criteria: This question resolves as **Yes** if a Chinese model has a higher Arena Score than all models with Anthropic as their Organization at the [Chatbot Arena Leaderboard](https://lmarena.ai/?leaderboard) in the "Overall" category when accessed by Metaculus on or after April 1, 2025.
question_details.fine_print: A Chinese model is defined as one whose Organization is headquartered in the People's Republic of China or conducts a majority of its R&D activities in the PRC. At the time of this question, models that qualified under this definition were Yi-Lightning, from 01 AI; Qwen2.5-plus-1127, from Alibaba; and GLM-4-Plus, from Zhipu AI.

news:
Here are the relevant news articles:

**Google Releases Gemma 3 Series of Models, a Single-GPU Model with High Performance**
Google has released the Gemma 3 series of models, which are the most advanced, portable, and responsible open-source models developed by Google. According to Google's blog, Gemma 3 is 'the world's best single-GPU model'. It supports over 35 languages and can analyze text, images, and short videos. The model's advantages include its ability to run directly on mobile phones, PCs, and workstations, with parameter sizes of 1B, 4B, 12B, and 27B. Developers can choose the parameter size based on their specific hardware and performance requirements. In the initial human preference evaluation on the LMArena leaderboard, Gemma 3 outperformed Llama-405B, DeepSeek-V3, and o3-mini. Google has also released a 4B-parameter image safety classifier called ShieldGemma 2, which can be used to filter image inputs and outputs to detect explicit, violent, or dangerous content. Google has also provided a quantized version of the model, which can run on a single GPU, unlike other models that may require up to 32 GPUs. According to the Chatbot Arena Elo score ranking, Gemma 3-27B has a high score, indicating that it is highly favored by users. The model's paper mentions that all models were evaluated by human scorers in a blind and parallel manner, and each model received an Elo score. Gemma-3-27B-IT scored higher than DeepSeek-V3 and o3-preview in the initial human preference evaluation on the LMArena leaderboard. Gemma 3 supports over 35 languages out of the box and provides pre-trained support for over 140 languages. It can also help developers create AI functions with advanced text and visual reasoning capabilities, such as image, text, and short video analysis applications. Gemma 3 supports function calls and structured output, enabling developers to automate tasks and build agents. Google has also released a 4B-parameter image safety classifier called ShieldGemma 2, which can be used to filter image inputs and outputs to detect explicit, violent, or dangerous content. The model's training data includes a larger token budget than Gemma 2, with 14T tokens used for the 27B version, 12T tokens used for the 12B version, 4T tokens used for the 4B version, and 2T tokens used for the 1B version. The model also uses a SentencePiece Tokenizer with 262k entries, which is more balanced for non-English languages. Gemma 3 uses filtering techniques to reduce unnecessary or unsafe speech risks and delete certain personal information and other sensitive data. The model's development tools include Hugging Face Transformers, Ollama, JAX, Keras, PyTorch, Google AI Edge, UnSloth, vLLM, and Gemma.cpp. Developers can access Gemma 3 in Google AI Studio or download the model through Kaggle or Hugging Face. The model also provides a customized code library for efficient fine-tuning and inference, which can be used in Google Colab, Vertex AI, or game GPUs. Gemma 3 provides multiple deployment options, including Vertex AI, Cloud Run, Google GenAI API, and local environments. NVIDIA has directly optimized the Gemma 3 model to ensure that developers can achieve the highest performance on devices ranging from Jetson Nano to the latest Blackwell chip. Gemma 3 is now available on the NVIDIA API directory, where developers can call the API to achieve rapid prototyping. NVIDIA API directory: https://build.nvidia.com/search?q=gemma. Gemma 3 has also been optimized for Google Cloud TPU and integrated with AMD GPU through the open-source ROCm stack. Conclusion: Low-hardware-demand models are popular, Google's Gemma 3 academic plan is launched. The attention to DeepSeek and other models highlights the interest of developers in models with low hardware requirements. Therefore, Google has also launched the Gemma 3 academic plan to further promote academic research breakthroughs. Academic researchers can apply for Google Cloud credits (worth $10,000 each) to accelerate their research based on Gemma 3. The application form is now open and will remain open for four weeks.
Original language: zh
Publish date: March 12, 2025 11:30 AM
Source:[凤凰网（凤凰新媒体）](https://tech.ifeng.com/c/8hfS3I6v43h)

**Can Chinese AI 'Manus' Surpass 'Chat GPT' Dominance?**
The Chinese AI, 'Manus', has been making waves in the tech world, but can it surpass the dominance of 'Chat GPT'? Manus is a new AI model that focuses on practical solutions, unlike its predecessors. According to its creator, Yishao Bi, Manus is not just another chatbot, but a new generation of AI that can perform tasks and produce real results independently. Manus has the ability to perform complex tasks such as browsing, clicking on links, data analysis, and even making purchases and investments on behalf of users. This is similar to other models like 'Cloud' from 'Anthropie' and 'Deep Research' from Chat GPT, but Manus focuses on actual execution, helping users complete tasks rather than just providing recommendations. Manus is currently in its experimental phase, where its capabilities are being tested and potential issues are being identified before its official launch. Despite the hype surrounding Manus, there are growing concerns about data security and privacy, particularly with the increasing tensions between China and the West. The US and European countries have been cautious about Chinese technology, imposing restrictions on Chinese apps like 'TikTok' and 'Huawei' due to cybersecurity concerns. With Manus entering the scene, some predict it will face challenges in global adoption, especially in Western markets with strict regulations on Chinese systems.
Original language: ar
Publish date: March 12, 2025 02:27 AM
Source:[tahiamasr.com](https://www.tahiamasr.com/929426)

**New Chinese AI Program 'Manus' Sparks Interest and Concerns**
The Chinese artificial intelligence program 'Manus' has sparked interest among experts in the field, generating limited enthusiasm, disappointment, and concerns about data security. The program's creator, Yishao Bi, said in a promotional video, 'It's not just another chatbot'. He added, 'It's an independent program already', stating that while other AI systems generate ideas, 'Manus' provides results, and we see it as the next model for human-machine collaboration.' Since the launch of 'Chat GPT' in late 2022, major tech companies and startups have been competing to develop advanced AI assistants. There are programs with similar capabilities, such as 'Cloud' by 'Anthropi' and 'Chat GPT' with its 'Deep Research' feature. 'Patr Fly Effect', the Chinese startup that developed 'Manus', has showcased examples of tasks that its AI assistant can perform, including 'buying a property in New York'. The company stated that 'Manus' is still in its initial testing phase and is working to improve its performance gradually. 'Manus' can also prepare research reports, analyze financial data, and program games.
Original language: ar
Publish date: March 11, 2025 11:36 PM
Source:[سكاي نيوز عربية](https://www.skynewsarabia.com/technology/1783133-%D8%A8%D8%B1%D9%86%D8%A7%D9%85%D8%AC-%D8%B0%D9%83%D8%A7%D8%A1-%D8%A7%D8%B5%D8%B7%D9%86%D8%A7%D8%B9%D9%8A-%D8%B5%D9%8A%D9%86%D9%8A-%D8%AC%D8%AF%D9%8A%D8%AF-%D9%8A%D9%86%D8%A7%D9%81%D8%B3-%D8%AA%D8%B4%D8%A7%D8%AA-%D8%AC%D9%8A-%D8%AA%D9%8A%D8%9F)

**Chinese AI Program 'Manus' Challenges 'Chat GPT' with Independent Capabilities**
The Chinese AI program 'Manus' has gained attention from experts in the field, sparking limited enthusiasm, disappointment, and concerns about data security. The program's creator, Yishao Bi, said in a promotional video, 'It's not just another chatbot'. He added, 'It's actually an independent program', stating that 'Manus' provides results, and 'we see it as the next step in human-machine collaboration'. Since the launch of 'Chat GPT' in late 2022, major tech companies and startups have been competing to develop advanced AI assistants. Programs like 'Manus' and 'Chat GPT' have similar capabilities, allowing them to act independently to some extent, replacing users to perform tasks online such as browsing and clicking links, and creating summaries. For example, the 'Cloud' program from 'Anthropi' works with the 'Computer User' setting launched in October, and 'Chat GPT' with the 'Deep Research' feature. As Kyle Wiggers, a journalist at 'TechCrunch', pointed out, AI-powered assistant programs have failed to order food and book a ticket to Japan.
Original language: ar
Publish date: March 11, 2025 09:17 PM
Source:[البيان](https://www.albayan.ae/technology/science-technology/artificial-intelligence/32739)

**Meet 4 of the Chinese AI models upending the market**
China's AI scene is heating up, with new models rivaling top US players and rattling the stock market. Manus, an AI agent, is being hailed as the next potential 'DeepSeek moment.' DeepSeek was the first Chinese AI startup to shake up the industry, with its R1 model rivaling top competitors like ChatGPT's o1. Alibaba has become a key player to watch after it open-sourced its QwQ-32B model, which used less data than DeepSeek and sent its stock surging 8%. Tencent's AI chatbot Yuanbao topped China's iOS App Store last week, surpassing DeepSeek as the most downloaded free app. Researchers at Monica said Manus is the world's first fully autonomous AI agent, outperforming OpenAI's Deep Research model on the GAIA benchmark. However, some users questioned whether Manus was built from scratch, and others called it overhyped, citing factual errors and execution failures during tests.
Original language: en
Publish date: March 11, 2025 10:11 AM
Source:[Business Insider](https://www.businessinsider.com/chinese-ai-models-manus-deepseek-alibaba-tencent-2025-3)

**Manus AI: The New Chinese Intelligent and Autonomous Agent**
Manus AI, a new Chinese intelligent and autonomous agent, has been unveiled in March 2025. This tool is presented as the first agent capable of performing complex tasks autonomously, from start to finish. Unlike other chatbots like ChatGPT and Gemini, Manus can complete tasks without continuous human interaction. 'We are building what we think is the next evolution in AI. It's not just another chatbot, but a truly autonomous agent that bridges the gap between design and execution,' explains Yichao 'Peak' Ji, one of Manus' co-founders. Manus has been demonstrated to produce impressive results in various tasks, such as market analysis and project management. It uses a multi-agent model, combining several specialized AI models, and can interact with the web autonomously using the 'Browser use' tool. Manus has outperformed GPT-4 in benchmarking tests, scoring 86.5% on a set of 466 questions, compared to GPT-4's 74.3%.
Original language: fr
Publish date: March 11, 2025 06:18 AM
Source:[Le Point.fr](https://www.lepoint.fr/high-tech-internet/qu-est-ce-que-manus-ai-ce-nouvel-agent-intelligent-et-autonome-chinois-11-03-2025-2584380_47.php)

**Chinese AI agent Manus transcends chatbots, start-up's founder says**
Manus, a Chinese AI agent developed by Butterfly Effect, claims to surpass traditional chatbots in performance. According to Red Xiao Hong, the founder and CEO, Manus is 'more like a human being' because it interacts with its environment, collects feedback, and uses it as a new prompt. Manus is built on existing Large Language Models (LLMs), including Anthropic's Claude and fine-tuned versions of Alibaba Group Holding's Qwen. This allows Manus to perform tasks such as devising an itinerary for a trip to Japan, analyzing Tesla's stock, and providing real-estate tips in New York based on a family's requirements.
Original language: en
Publish date: March 11, 2025 04:00 AM
Source:[South China Morning Post](https://www.scmp.com/tech/tech-trends/article/3301864/chinese-ai-agent-manus-transcends-chatbots-founder-start-butterfly-effect-says)

**China Develops First Autonomous AI Agent, Challenging US Leadership**
Some experts believe that the emergence of Manus challenges the narrative that the US is the undisputed leader in developing advanced AI. This suggests that China has caught up and possibly surpassed the US in developing truly autonomous AI agents. In January, Chinese company DeepSeek released a free chatbot that caused panic among investors in Silicon Valley and outperformed American ChatGPT in several reasoning tests. Additionally, Alibaba's AI division, Qwen, released an AI model, QwQ-32B, which is comparable to DeepSeek's development. 'This is a significant development that shows China's rapid progress in AI,' said an expert, although no specific name is mentioned. 'It's a wake-up call for the US to reassess its AI strategy and catch up with China's advancements.'
Original language: ru
Publish date: March 11, 2025 03:56 AM
Source:[Корреспондент.net](https://korrespondent.net/tech/technews/4762721-v-kytae-zaiavyly-o-sozdanyy-pervoho-v-myre-avtonomnoho-ahenta-yy)

**Aliyun Releases QwQ-32B Model, a New Open-Source Large Model**
Aliyun has officially released the 'QwQ-32B' model, a new open-source large model developed by the Aliyun team. This model has surpassed the performance of the 'DeepSeek-R1' model in multiple authoritative evaluations, including math, code, and general capabilities. The QwQ-32B model has quickly become the most popular open-source model on the Hugging Face platform, with over 10,000 derivative models created. Aliyun has also open-sourced the Qwen and Wan series of models, covering a range of sizes from 0.5B to 110B. These models have won numerous awards in the Chatbot Arena and OpenCompass competitions, and have been used to create over 100,000 models. Aliyun's CTO, Zhou Jingren, has stated that the company will continue to promote the development of the Chinese AI ecosystem, providing developers with access to the most powerful computing resources and development tools. Aliyun has also announced plans to invest over 380 billion yuan in cloud and AI infrastructure over the next three years, with the goal of reducing the cost of AI training and making it more accessible to developers.
Original language: zh
Publish date: March 11, 2025 01:54 AM
Source:[凤凰网（凤凰新媒体）](https://hb.ifeng.com/c/8hcyfGaRyy6)

**China's National Pride: The Rise of Humanoid Robots**
In China, humanoid robots enhanced with artificial intelligence have made significant progress in dancing. At the Chinese New Year's Eve gala, a team of robotic dancers mixed with human performers for a futuristic and impressive show. The robots moved with fluidity and precision, making them the stars of the most important TV event in China. The robots are produced by the Chinese start-up Unitree Robotics, which sees the G1 model as a precursor to mass production. The G1 robot is available for 13,000 euros and is being used by some companies as entertainers at trade shows and advertising events. Beijing's economic planners see robotics as a promising consumer trend. They hope to create a 'disruptive' product like laptops, smartphones, or electric cars, which could potentially be in every household. Unitree's founder, Wang Xingxing, is currently in high favor with the Beijing government, along with Liang Wenfeng, who developed the DeepSeek AI model. KI-chatbots and humanoid robots are seen as particularly effective in highlighting China's ambitions to technological leadership on a global scale. However, two-legged robots are considered impractical due to technical difficulties. For example, a recent 'football tournament' in Shanghai, where robots played a game of soccer, was more like a geriatric game of stand-up football. While robots can be programmed to perform complex movements, adapting to a human opponent with two legs is still a 'next level' challenge.
Original language: de
Publish date: March 10, 2025 02:10 PM
Source:[boersen-zeitung.de](https://www.boersen-zeitung.de/meinung-analyse/nationalstolze-tanzroboter)

**GPT 4.5 Becomes #1 on Chatbot Arena!**
OpenAI's GPT-4.5 has become the #1 model on the Chatbot Arena LLM Leaderboard, securing over 3,200+ votes and excelling in Style Control and Multi-Turn interactions. According to the leaderboard, GPT-4.5 has a strong average win rate of 56% against other models, showing its ability to handle various tasks well. This milestone reaffirms OpenAI's leading role in advancing AI technology, despite intense competition. As described by the Chatbot Arena LLM Leaderboard, 'The Chatbot Arena LLM Leaderboard is a platform that compares large language models by having them compete against each other. It collects user opinions from many interactions, looking at things like accuracy, creativity, understanding context, and conversation skills.' This achievement sets a high benchmark for future innovations in the competitive landscape of large language models.
Original language: en
Publish date: March 03, 2025 05:59 PM
Source:[Analytics Vidhya](https://www.analyticsvidhya.com/blog/2025/03/gpt-4-5-becomes-1-on-chatbot-arena/)

**Chatbot Arena Italia: A Platform for Comparing Large Language Models**
Chatbot Arena Italia, a platform for comparing Large Language Models (LLM), has been made available to the public. This platform allows users to compare the responses of different chatbots, including popular ones like ChatGPT, to the same question. The idea is to create a ranking of the best LLMs specifically for the Italian language, where users can give a score to each response and determine which chatbot provided the best answer. The platform offers three modes: Arena (battles), where two LLMs are compared anonymously; Arena (side by side), where two AI are selected manually and compared; and Chat, where a user can select a chatbot and start a conversation. Chatbot Arena Italia is free and allows users to access paid versions of chatbots like ChatGPT, as well as Italian chatbots like Minerva and Modello Italia, and the Chinese chatbot DeepSeek. 'It's a great opportunity to compare the responses of different chatbots and determine which one is the best for the Italian language,' said the author of the article. 'We can finally have a democratic way to compare LLMs and choose the best one for our language.'
Original language: it
Publish date: February 25, 2025 07:29 PM
Source:[macitynet.it](https://www.macitynet.it/chatbot-arena-italia/)

**Grok-3 Takes the Lead in Chatbot Arena's February 2025 Rankings**
The Chatbot Arena, a platform that compares AI models, has released its leaderboard for February 2025. Grok-3, developed by xAI, has taken the top spot with a score of 1,402. However, it's essential to note that the results are based on unique prompts decided by users, and may not reflect the full capabilities of the models. For example, ChatGPT-4o excels in image and document analysis, has advanced vocal mode, and is better at online research. The top 10 models are: Grok-3, Gemini 2.0, ChatGPT-4o, DeepSeek R1, Qwen, Claude, Mistral, LLaMA, BERT, and PaLM. The Chatbot Arena uses a system of duels between anonymous models, with users determining the best response to a given request. The Elo system is used to evaluate the models and establish a dynamic ranking based on their performance.
Original language: fr
Publish date: February 21, 2025 09:39 AM
Source:[blogdumoderateur.com](https://www.blogdumoderateur.com/ia-modeles-plus-performants-fevrier-2025/)

**Elon Musk just released an AI that’s smarter than ChatGPT — here’s why that matters**
Elon Musk's xAI has released Grok 3, an AI model that outperforms leading competitors across key technical benchmarks. The model has achieved superior scores in mathematics, scientific reasoning, and coding tasks, and has topped the influential Chatbot Arena leaderboard. Former OpenAI researcher Andrej Karpathy praised Grok 3's 'state of the art thinking capabilities', but noted that it sometimes fabricates citations and struggles with certain types of humor and ethical reasoning tasks. The model's development required massive computational resources, with xAI doubling its GPU cluster to 200,000 Nvidia chips. The launch intensifies competition in the AI industry, particularly as Chinese startup DeepSeek recently demonstrated comparable performance with reportedly lower computational requirements.
Original language: en
Publish date: February 18, 2025 07:51 PM
Source:[venturebeat.com](https://venturebeat.com/ai/elon-musk-just-released-an-ai-thats-smarter-than-chatgpt-heres-why-that-matters/)

**Anthropic's New AI Model: A Hybrid Approach to Reasoning and Speed**
Anthropic is set to release a new AI model that combines 'deep reasoning' with fast response times in a hybrid system. According to The Information, the model will feature a 'sliding scale' that allows developers to choose between more computationally intensive reasoning functions and faster responses, optimizing costs. Initial tests suggest that the new model, expected to be released in the coming weeks, outperforms OpenAI's o3-mini-high 'reasoning' model on various programming tasks. It excels particularly in analyzing large codebases and business-relevant benchmarks. Anthropic CEO Dario Amodei has expressed skepticism towards the strict separation between normal and reasoning models, instead pursuing a more nuanced approach. Despite being a top contender with its previous model Claude 3.5 Sonnet, Anthropic has fallen out of the top 15 on the important Chatbot Arena Leaderboard due to the influx of new AI models from OpenAI, DeepSeek, Alibaba, Google, and xAI. However, with nearly $15 billion in investments from companies like Amazon and Google, expectations are high for the OpenAI challenger, which will also provide the foundation for Amazon's revamped Alexa assistant.
Original language: de
Publish date: February 14, 2025 08:37 AM
Source:[trendingtopics.eu](https://www.trendingtopics.eu/anthropic-unter-druck-neues-ai-modell-kommt-bald-soll-mit-openai-und-deepseek-gleichziehen/)

**Qwen2.5-Max: China's AI Model Surpasses DeepSeek and Enters Top 10 Global Rankings**
Qwen2.5-Max, a large language model (LLM) developed by Alibaba Cloud, has made impressive results on Chatbot Arena, a platform for evaluating LLMs and AI chatbots. It entered the top 10 global rankings for the first time, with strong performances in coding and mathematics. Qwen2.5-Max surpassed models like DeepSeek-V3, o1-mini, and Claude-3.5-Sonnet. DeepSeek-R1 and ChatGPT-4o are still tied for third place in the global performance ranking, according to Chatbot Arena's website. Qwen2.5-Max ranked first in mathematics and programming, and second in Hard Prompts. 'Qwen-Max from Alibaba is strong in all areas, especially in technical domains (coding, mathematics, Hard Prompts)', said Chatbot Arena on X. Vilmate, a technology-focused blog, published an article titled 'DeepSeek and Qwen2.5-Max: China's bold move to lead the AI race'. It described Qwen2.5-Max as a powerful AI model that surpasses DeepSeek V3 and GPT-4o. Enthusiasts have openly praised Qwen2.5-Max on social media. 'I used Qwen-Max, and it's a very good model. I believe in Chinese technologies and hope to continue on the path of sharing and open source', wrote a user on X under the official account of Qwen. 'Qwen is one of the first open-source models from China and has been recognized as a leading national model for a long time. However, it has attracted significant global attention after the release of a new version during the Spring Festival, shortly after the emergence of DeepSeek as a global competitor', said Li Baiyang, associate professor of intelligence studies at Nanjing University. 'China has firmly established itself as a force that cannot be ignored and must be recognized and evaluated with objectivity and fairness', said Shen Yang, professor studying AI and media at Tsinghua University, Beijing. However, Australia has banned all services from Chinese technology company DeepSeek on government systems and devices, following similar measures taken by US agencies, including NASA and the Pentagon. These measures have been criticized by Chinese observers, as they show, according to them, 'that some Western countries are unable to evaluate China's technological progress in a fair and objective manner'. 'I think since DeepSeek to the recognition of Qwen2.5-Max by users and technology communities, the contribution of Chinese developers to the open-source ecosystem, a noble ideal and practice for programmers, has increased significantly', said Mr. Shen. Several US tech giants, including Microsoft, Nvidia, and Amazon, have adopted the latest AI reasoning model from DeepSeek, reported various media. 'Thanks to open-source, Chinese AI models offer developers worldwide an open platform for innovation and applications, accelerating global adoption of AI, which ultimately benefits the entire technological ecosystem', assured Mr. Shen. 'AI technology should not be monopolized by a few, as monopolization could lead to AI supremacy and control by a privileged few.' 
Original language: fr
Publish date: February 06, 2025 07:01 AM
Source:[china.org.cn/china.com.cn(中国网)](http://french.china.org.cn/business/txt/2025-02/06/content_117698260.htm)

**Google’s Gemini 2.0 series now broadly available via API, Gemini app**
Google's Gemini 2.0 series is now available via API and the Gemini app. The models have already ranked #1, #2, #5, and #10 on the Chatbot Arena LLM Leaderboard. Meanwhile, China has surpassed the US in the number of top AI models, with 7 out of the top 21 models being Chinese. OpenAI's o3 and o1 models have led the frontier AI model race, but DeepSeek's R1 and V3 models are close behind. Chinese AI models have been catching up to US models on benchmarks since 2024, with 4 of the top-5 reasoning AI models coming from Chinese labs. DeepSeek took the lead from Alibaba in late 2024 with the release of the V3 model.
Original language: en
Publish date: February 06, 2025 12:00 AM
Source:[bayareatimes.com](https://www.bayareatimes.com/p/google-s-gemini-2-0-series-now-broadly-available-via-api-gemini-app)

**Aliyun's Qwen 2.5-Max Model Tops Global AI Large Model Leaderboard**
Aliyun announced that its Qwen 2.5-Max model has topped the latest AI large model leaderboard, Chatbot Arena, with a score of 1332, ranking seventh globally. In addition, Qwen2.5-Max ranked first in mathematics and programming, and second in hard prompts. Aliyun stated that Qwen2.5-Max performed well in various benchmark tests, including Arena-Hard, LiveBench, LiveCodeBench, GPQA-Diamond, and MMLU-Pro, surpassing GPT-4o, DeepSeek-V3, and Llama-3.1-405B. 'Qwen2.5-Max is a non-reasoning Chinese large model champion,' said Aliyun. 'It has surpassed DeepSeek V3, Open AI o1-mini, and Claude-3.5-Sonnet in Chatbot Arena.' 
Original language: zh
Publish date: February 05, 2025 11:54 AM
Source:[凤凰网（凤凰新媒体）](https://tech.ifeng.com/c/8gjLlvGftJl)

**Aliyun's Qwen2.5-Max Model Surpasses DeepSeek and Rivals OpenAI's o1 Series**
Aliyun's Qwen2.5-Max model has surpassed DeepSeek and become the second Chinese model to rival OpenAI's o1 series. According to the LMArena's 'ChatBot Arena LLM' rankings, Qwen2.5-Max scored 1332 points, ranking 7th overall, surpassing DeepSeek's DeepSeek-V3 and OpenAI's o1-mini. In mathematics and programming, Qwen2.5-Max ranked 1st, and in Hard prompts, it ranked 2nd. The rankings were based on 2.6 million user votes and are considered an authoritative benchmark in the industry. Aliyun's Qwen2.5-Max model has shown global-leading performance in various tests, including knowledge, coding, and comprehensive evaluation. It also surpassed all comparison models in the 'Arena-Hard' test, which evaluates a model's ability to understand complex commands and engage in multi-round conversations. 'Qwen2.5-Max' demonstrated its ability to quickly analyze problems, integrate relevant knowledge, and provide accurate and comprehensive answers, scoring 89.4 points. According to Aliyun, Qwen2.5-Max was compared to the leading open-source MoE model DeepSeek V3, the largest open-source dense model Llama-3.1-405B, and the open-source dense model Qwen2.5-72B. In all 11 benchmark tests, including MMLU, Qwen2.5-Max surpassed all comparison models. The ChatBot Arena official evaluation stated, 'Qwen2.5-Max performed strongly in multiple fields, particularly in professional technical areas such as programming, mathematics, and hard prompts.'
Original language: zh
Publish date: February 05, 2025 07:24 AM
Source:[k.sina.com.cn](https://k.sina.com.cn/article_1887344341_707e96d502001kxqe.html)

**Qwen2.5-Max: Alibaba's New Large Language Model Surpasses Global Competitors**
Qwen2.5-Max, a new large language model developed by Alibaba's Aliyun Tianti team, has surpassed DeepSeek V3, o1-mini, and Claude-3.5-Sonnet in the Chatbot Arena LLM Leaderboard, ranking 7th globally with a score of 1332. Qwen-Max shows exceptional comprehensive performance in various benchmark tests, including Arena-Hard, LiveBench, LiveCodeBench, GPQA-Diamond, and MMLU-Pro. The model has been praised by ChatBot Arena officials for its strong performance in professional technical fields, such as programming, mathematics, and hard prompts. According to the developers, continuous improvement of data scale and model parameter scale can effectively enhance model intelligence. They are confident in the next version of Qwen2.5-Max and plan to explore further, including scaling up pre-training and reinforcement learning. 'With Qwen2.5-max, can we say goodbye to ChatGPT?' said an Arabic-speaking user. Many overseas users expressed their amazement at Qwen2.5-max's extreme performance. 'Another Chinese model has arrived,' joked a user, referring to OpenAI's CEO Sam Altman. 'The iteration speed and quality of Chinese models are stunning,' said several overseas users.
Original language: zh
Publish date: February 05, 2025 03:02 AM
Source:[凤凰网（凤凰新媒体）](https://tech.ifeng.com/c/8ghZ7IGCLDf)

**Qwen2.5-Max Ranks Seventh Globally in Large Model Blind Testing Rankings**
Chatbot Arena, a three-party benchmark testing platform, released the latest global large model blind testing rankings on February 4. The newly released Qwen2.5-Max surpassed DeepSeek V3, o1-mini, and Claude-3.5-Sonnet, ranking seventh globally with a score of 1332, and becoming the non-reasoning class champion of Chinese large models. Additionally, Qwen2.5-Max ranked first in math and programming, and second in hard prompts. 'Qwen2.5-Max's outstanding performance demonstrates the rapid progress of Chinese large models in the field of natural language processing,' said the author. However, the author also emphasized that 'the accuracy, reliability, and completeness of the content in this article are not guaranteed.' 
Original language: zh
Publish date: February 05, 2025 03:00 AM
Source:[和讯网](http://tech.hexun.com/2025-02-05/217109181.html)

**Qwen2.5-Max: A New Global Model Leaderboard Champion**
Aliyun's Qwen2.5-Max has topped the global model leaderboard, surpassing DeepSeek V3, o1-mini, and Claude-3.5-Sonnet, with a score of 1332, ranking 7th globally. Qwen2.5-Max also ranked 1st in math and programming, and 2nd in hard prompts. The model has shown excellent comprehensive performance in various benchmark tests, including Arena-Hard, LiveBench, LiveCodeBench, GPQA-Diamond, and MMLU-Pro. ChatBot Arena officials praised Qwen2.5-Max's strong performance in multiple fields, particularly in professional technical areas such as programming, math, and difficult prompts. 'With Qwen2.5-max, we can say goodbye to ChatGPT?' said a user in Arabic. Many overseas users expressed their amazement at Qwen2.5-max's extreme performance. The Aliyun team is confident in the next version of Qwen2.5-Max and will continue to explore, focusing on scaling up pre-training and reinforcement learning to achieve human-level intelligence and drive AI exploration of the unknown.
Original language: zh
Publish date: February 04, 2025 11:33 AM
Source:[东方财富网](https://finance.eastmoney.com/a/202502043310254134.html)

**DeepSeek AI Models Prices 10-20 Times Lower Than OpenAI**
DeepSeek, a Chinese startup, has caused a stir in the AI industry with its powerful and affordable AI models. The company's two key language models, DeepSeek R1 and DeepSeek V3, have the potential to not only compete with market leaders like OpenAI, Google, and Anthropic, but also surpass them, while using significantly fewer resources. One of the biggest surprises in the industry is the extremely low prices of these models. According to DeepSeek, the prices of their models are based on the amount of input and output data, with one unit being one million tokens. The input data for V3 is ten times cheaper than for GPT-4o Mini, and twenty times cheaper than for Claude 3 Haiku from Anthropic. The output data for V3 is also cheaper, but still more expensive than for GPT-4o Mini. DeepSeek's model R1 is the most affordable among the most powerful models, with prices that are significantly lower than those of Gemini 1.5 Pro and Nova Pro from Amazon. 'DeepSeek's models can not only compete with other models in terms of price, but also demonstrate high performance, making it difficult to justify the high prices of other providers,' said a spokesperson for DeepSeek. As of now, R1 is ranked first in the 'Style Control' rating on the Chatbot Arena website, alongside ChatGPT-4o and Gemini-Exp-1206.

However, it has not been a given for Chinese models to consistently outperform U.S. models like those from Anthropic. Reviewing past performances, Chinese models have occasionally but not consistently surpassed U.S. models significantly in domains such as natural language processing. For instance, in specific benchmarks, Chinese models have shown capabilities comparable to leading U.S. models. As of late 2024, there has been an increased presence and competence demonstrated by Chinese AI firms, but outright dominance is sporadic. Therefore, establishing a base rate of Chinese models outperforming highly competitive U.S. models such as Anthropic's around 25% seems reasonable, considering this historical backdrop.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Government Support
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: The Chinese government's strategic focus on AI and significant investment into its development enhances the infrastructure and manpower dedicated to AI projects, which can accelerate improvement in model performance.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Technological Advancements
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: The rapid advancement in technological capabilities and innovations in Chinese AI companies, combined with increased collaborations with academic institutions, influences the development speed and sophistication of new AI models.

perspective_derived_factors.name: International Pressure
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: International scrutiny and export restrictions imposed by Western countries may limit the resources available to Chinese AI firms, affecting their ability to quickly adapt and innovate in certain situations.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Anthropic's Current Model Strength
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: Anthropic, a leading AI company, has shown consistent improvements in AI models and maintained strong positions on the leaderboard, showcasing a robust pipeline and model development which may maintain or improve their standing.

analysis_updates.points_reinforcing_prior_analysis: Chinese AI models like Qwen2.5-Max are gaining impressive ranks on global leaderboards, demonstrating strong performance in coding, mathematics, and hard prompts. China's investment in AI infrastructure and open-source model development is drawing significant attention globally, reinforcing the potential for Chinese models to outperform competitors.
analysis_updates.points_challenging_prior_analysis: The introduction of Google's Gemma 3 and OpenAI's GPT-4.5 models to the Chatbot Arena leaderboard introduces strong competitors. Additionally, the launch of Anthropic's potentially improved AI models backed with significant investments also poses a challenge to the dominance of Chinese models. These models may overshadow any recent gains by Chinese models in the leaderboard rankings.

phase_1_result.initial_reasoning: Historically, Chinese AI models have improved significantly, with increasing competitive performance against their US counterparts. However, US-based firms like Anthropic have consistently remained at the forefront of AI technology. The likelihood of any single firm, including Chinese ones, surpassing Anthropic is historically low but not negligible.

analysis_updates.points_reinforcing_prior_analysis: The news indicates strong performance and interest in Chinese AI models like Qwen2.5-Max and Manus, suggesting rapid progress and potential to challenge US models. Qwen2.5-Max has been praised for its performance, surpassing notable competitors in benchmark tests and reaching the top of the Chatbot Arena leaderboard in specific categories.
analysis_updates.points_challenging_prior_analysis: Despite Chinese advancements, there is continued dominance from models like GPT-4.5 and new entrants like Grok-3 also taking top positions in rankings. summary: After reviewing the news articles and reconsidering their initial analyses, most forecasting experts increased the probability that a Chinese AI model will have a higher Arena Score than all Anthropic models on the Chatbot Arena Leaderboard by the end of the first quarter of 2025. The revised probabilities across different experts generally range from 45% to 65%, with a few exceptions predicting lower odds. The experts cite recent strong performances by Chinese models like Qwen2.5-Max and Manus, which have shown competitive capabilities in global benchmarks. However, they also acknowledge the strong competition from other leading AI models, particularly from OpenAI and Google's new releases, as well as Anthropic's continued developments, which present significant challenges to Chinese models dominating the leaderboard.
